definitions.text: the (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
examples: he had the hands of a surgeon
he extended his mitt

definitions.text: a hired laborer on a farm or ranch
examples: the hired hand fixed the railing
a ranch hand
she recognized his handwriting
his hand was illegible
he wanted to try his hand at singing

definitions.text: a position given by its location to the side of an object
examples: objections were voiced on every hand

definitions.text: the cards held in a card game by a given player at any given time
examples: I didn't hold a good hand all evening
he kept trying to see my hand

definitions.text: one of two sides of an issue
examples: on the one hand..., but on the other hand...

definitions.text: a rotating pointer on the face of a timepiece
examples: the big hand counts the minutes

definitions.text: a unit of length equal to 4 inches; used in measuring horses
examples: the horse stood 20 hands

definitions.text: a member of the crew of a ship
examples: all hands on deck

definitions.text: a card player in a game of bridge
examples: we need a 4th hand for bridge

definitions.text: a round of applause to signify approval
examples: give the little lady a great big hand

definitions.text: terminal part of the forelimb in certain vertebrates (e.g. apes or kangaroos); - Springfield (Mass.) Union
examples: the kangaroo's forearms seem undeveloped but the powerful five-fingered hands are skilled at feinting and clouting
give me a hand with the chores

definitions.text: place into the hands or custody of
examples: hand me the spoon, please
Turn the files over to me, please
He turned over the prisoner to his lawyers

definitions.text: guide or conduct or usher somewhere
examples: hand the elderly lady into the taxi
